problems.title: Caesar's Secret
problems.description: Julius Caesar used this simple cipher to protect his military communications. Each letter is shifted by a fixed number of positions in the alphabet.
hints: Try shifting each letter by 3 positions backward
A becomes X, B becomes Y, C becomes Z

problems.title: Mirror Writing
problems.description: An ancient Hebrew cipher where the alphabet is reversed. A becomes Z, B becomes Y, and so on.

problems.title: The Unbreakable Cipher
problems.description: Once thought to be unbreakable, this polyalphabetic cipher uses a keyword to encrypt the message.
hints: Each letter of the keyword shifts the corresponding plaintext letter

problems.title: Square Dance
problems.description: A digraph substitution cipher using a 5√ó5 grid of letters. Pairs of letters are encrypted together.
hints: Replace J with I in the grid

problems.title: Dots and Dashes
problems.description: Not exactly a cipher, but a code system using dots and dashes to represent letters.
hints: This is a famous distress signal
